title: Search for Repositories on GitHub
description: Learn how to use GitHub's search feature to find repositories, code, and projects. GitHub search supports advanced filters and syntax for precise results.
prerequisites: GitHub account (optional, but recommended for saving searches)

steps.title: Navigate to GitHub Search
steps.description: GitHub's dedicated search page provides a clean interface for finding repositories, code, issues, and more. The search box accepts both simple queries and advanced syntax.
steps.expected_result: The GitHub search page loads with an empty search box ready for input.

steps.title: Enter your search query
steps.description: Type keywords that describe what you're looking for. GitHub searches repository names, descriptions, README files, and code by default.
steps.expected_result: Search results appear showing matching repositories sorted by best match. The sidebar shows filters for narrowing results by type, language, and more.

troubleshooting.description: Your search terms may be too specific or contain typos.
troubleshooting.resolution: Try broader keywords, check spelling, or use GitHub's search syntax like `in:readme` to search specific fields.

troubleshooting.description: Generic search terms return thousands of results.
troubleshooting.resolution: Use filters in the sidebar (language, stars, recently updated) or add qualifiers like `stars:>100` to your query.

troubleshooting.description: By default, search returns repositories, not code.
troubleshooting.resolution: Click 'Code' in the left sidebar or add `type:code` to your search query.
